intro: Bulbostylis oritrephes subsp. australis, commonly known as the Australian bulbostylis, is a small, flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense tufts of foliage. The species is distinguished by its slender, spike-like inflorescence that bears tiny, spikelet-like flowers. It typically thrives in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands or along watercourses. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
